meanings.sent1: I always endoss my friend's ideas during our group projects.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will endoss our science fair project if it meets all the requirements.
meanings.sent3: The team captain endosses the new strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to endoss the decision to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause from the audience seemed to endoss the singer's performance.

meanings.definition: To sign or write one's name on the back of a document
meanings.sent1: Please endoss the contract before submitting it to the manager.
meanings.sent2: He forgot to endoss the permission slip for the field trip.
meanings.sent3: The author had to endoss each page of the manuscript before sending it to the publisher.
meanings.sent4: She quickly endossed the letter and sealed it in the envelope.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to endoss the waiver form before participating in the competition.

meanings.definition: A signature on the back of a check for deposit or negotiation
meanings.sent1: Make sure the endoss on the check is clear for the bank to process it.
meanings.sent2: The endoss on the payment was illegible, causing a delay in the transaction.
meanings.sent3: The endoss on the check looked like a work of art with its intricate design.
meanings.sent4: She carefully examined the endoss on the check to verify its authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The endoss on the document indicated that the transaction was complete.
